channel.title: Glenn Thibeault
channel.description: Recent news about Glenn Thibeault, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Last report was over 10K people were at Bell Park today 4 #Sudbury Labour Day Funfest. Great way to celebrate/remember Labour & its history

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: #Sudbury's Labour Day Family Funfest just started and already started to fill up. Come on down - we're here till 4. http://t.co/QfNDBb2ffc

item.title: Mentioned by Sault Star
item.description:
NDP's Northern Ontario tour hits Sault
... August 29, 2013 4:10:49 EDT PM. Proposed amendments to the Navigable Waters Protection Act in the federal government's omnibus budget bill will take away environmental protection for all of Sudbury's 330 lakes, said Sudbury NDP MP Glenn Thibeault.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Two years ago, the NDP lost a great leader, the country lost a great visionary, and I lost a great friend and mentor. #lovehopeoptimism

item.title: Mentioned by NorthernLife.ca
item.description:
Thibeault takes on new critic role
Sudbury MP Glenn Thibeault has been named the small business and tourism critic in the NDP's shadow cabinet by the party's leader, Tom Mulcair. “I am proud to serve as New Democrat critic for small business and tourism,” said Thibeault, in a press release ...

item.title: Mentioned by The Sudbury Star
item.description:
Thibeault given more work in shadow cabinet
Sudbury MP Glenn Thibeault is taking on new responsibilities in the NDP's shadow cabinet. Thibeault, who remains as the consumer affairs critic, is now also the critic for small business and tourism. "I am proud to serve as New Democrat critic for Small ...

item.title: Mentioned by The Sudbury Star
item.description:
NDP to push for lower credit card fees: MP
A ruling dismissing a complaint about rules imposed on Canadian merchants by MasterCard and Visa shows the need for regulation of the credit card industry, Sudbury MP Glenn Thibeault said Tuesday. The decision, released Canada's Competition Tribunal ...
